a.content:
\overline{S} \subseteq \overline{T}.
\rightarrow X \subseteq \overline{T}.
\overline{T} \subseteq X \rightarrow \overline{T} = X

q.content: Hence show that if S is dense in X, then T is dense in X.

path: answers-db/books/Topology Without Tears/3. Limit Points/3.1 Limit Points and Closure/5/(iii)
